body.p: Lexington farmer, merchant, and politician. Married to Sally A. Clay Goodloe. Father of Speed S. Goodloe, W. Cassius Goodloe, David L. Goodloe, and Green Clay Goodloe. Owned five enslaved persons in 1850 and nine in 1860. Member of the Whig Party, Republican Party, and Union Party. Worked as a farmer in Madison County, Kentucky. Served as deputy sheriff in Madison County, Kentucky under his father. Served in the Kentucky State Militia, attaining the rank of major general. Worked as a bookseller and china merchant in Lexington, Kentucky. Appointed by President Abraham Lincoln as assessor in 1864. Served as chairman and member of the Union Executive Committee of Kentucky in 1865.
